metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38206 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The mac80211 subsystem in the Linux kernel before 5.12.13, when a device supporting only 5 GHz is used, allows attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference in the radiotap parser) by injecting a frame with 802.11a rates. Ben Greear discovered that the mac80211 subsystem in the Linux kernel contained a null pointer dereference in some situations. A physically proximate attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
